body.p: We suspect that automobile insurance premiums (in dollars) may be steadily decreasing with the driver's driving experience (in years), so we choose a random sample of drivers who have similar automobile insurance coverage and collect data about their ages and insurance premiums.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to determine if insurance premiums are decreasing with the driver's driving experience?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.

Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.
Incorrect. ANOVA is used for comparing the means of more than two groups. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.

Incorrect. A chi-squared test for independence is used to determine if there is an association between two categorical variables. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.
Correct. We are examining the relationship between two quantitative variables (case Q→Q)—premium (in dollars) and driving experience (in years)—and therefore inference for regression is appropriate.

body.p: We want to explore the relationship between the prices of diamond rings and the weights of their diamond stones.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to determine if there is a relationship between the price and weight of diamond rings?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Note that we are not comparing two groups here but rather examining the relationship between two quantitative variables.

Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Note that we are not comparing two groups here but rather examining the relationship between two quantitative variables.
Incorrect. ANOVA is used for comparing the means of more than two groups. Note that we are not comparing several groups here but rather exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables.
Incorrect. Recall that the chi-squared test is used to explore the relationship between two categorical variables. Note that price and weight are two quantitative variables.
Correct. Regression is used to examine the relationship between two quantitative variables such as price and weight.

body.p: Suppose an economist wishes to determine the relationship between the age and price of houses. A study yields the following data:

If column 1 is the age of the home in years, and column 2 is the price of the home (in hundreds of thousands of dollars), which of the following is the appropriate inference method to analyze these data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Matched pairs is used to test the same sample in a before and after situation. Notice that each subject is measured once for age and a second time for price, and that you want to see if there is a trend between the age of a house and its price.

Incorrect. Two independent samples is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Notice that each subject is measured once for age and a second time for price and that you want to see if there is a trend between the age of a house and its price.
Correct. We are examining the relationship between two quantitative variables: the age of the house and its price. Therefore, inference for regression is appropriate.

body.p: A researcher wants to explore the relationship between the following two variables, Weight 1 and Weight 2.

In preparing for a balsa wood bridge challenge, students weighed (in g) a random sample of five balsa wood designs and recorded these data as Weight 1. They also recorded the maximum weight (in kg) that the bridge could support. If the students want to know if there is an association between the weight of the bridge (in g) and the maximum weight supported (in kg), which of the following is the appropriate inference method to analyze these data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Matched pairs is used to test the same sample in a before and after situation. Note that in this scenario we're exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables, the weight of the balsa wood bridge and the weight that the bridge supported.

Incorrect. Two independent samples is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Note that we're not comparing two groups here, but rather exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables, weight of the balsa wood and the weight that the bridge supported.
Correct. The students want to know if there is an association between two quantitative variables, the weight of the balsa wood and the weight that the bridge supported.

body.p: A chemistry professor suspects that there is a relationship between the number of classes a student misses and that student’s score on the final exam (from 0 to 100%). The professor chooses a random sample of students in Introduction to Chemistry and collects data about each student’s final exam score and number of missed days of class.
Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to determine if there is a relationship between number of missed classes and final exam scores?

response.feedback: Incorrect. A matched pairs t-test is used to test the same group of subjects in a before and after situation. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.

Incorrect. A two-sample t-test is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.
Incorrect. ANOVA is used for comparing the means of more than two groups. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.

Incorrect. A chi-squared test for independence is used to determine if there is an association between two categorical variables. Notice that you are measuring two quantitative variables from each subject in order to see if there is a trend between them.
Correct. We are examining the relationship between two quantitative variables (case Q→Q): number of absences and exam score. Therefore, inference for regression is appropriate.

Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical test to use to determine if there is a relationship between salary and years of experience?

body.p: Suppose a classroom teacher wants to measure whether offering candy as a reward will increase the number of times that a student raises his/her hand to answer a question in class. A study yields the following data.

If column 1 is the number of candy rewards given for answering questions during a lesson, and column 2 is the number of students who raise their hand to answer questions during a lesson, which of the following is the appropriate inference method to analyze these data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Matched pairs is used to test the same sample in a before and after situation. Notice that each lesson is measured once for number of rewards given and a second time for number of students who raised their hand, and that you want to see if there is a trend between the number of rewards and number of students who raised their hands.

Incorrect. Two independent samples is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Notice that each lesson is measured once for number of rewards given and a second time for number of students who raised their hand, and that you want to see if there is a trend between the number of rewards and number of students who raised their hand.

Correct. We are examining the relationship between two quantitative variables: the number of candy rewards and the number of students raising their hands. Therefore, inference for regression is appropriate.

body.p: A researcher wants to explore the relationship between two variables: Time 1 and Time 2.

A group of student athletes was training for an obstacle course event by practicing a variety of exercises. Their coach wanted to know if the exercises were in fact related to their time to complete the obstacle course. Time 1 was each athlete’s time (in seconds) for 20 repetitions of shuttle runs (running back and forth between 2 cones placed 25 meters apart) during training. Time 2 was the same athlete’s time (in seconds) to complete the obstacle course during the competition. If the coach wants to see if there was an association between time to complete 20 shuttle runs during training (in seconds) and the time to complete the obstacle course during competition (in seconds), which of the following is the appropriate inference method to analyze these data?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Matched pairs is used to test the same sample in a before and after situation. Note that in this scenario we're exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables, the time to complete 20 shuttle runs during training (in seconds) and the time to complete the obstacle course during competition (in seconds). This would have been a matched pairs situation if the athletes had been measured on the same activity (shuttle run) in a before and after situation.

Incorrect. Two independent samples is used to test mean differences on one quantitative variable for two random samples. Note that we're not comparing two groups here, but rather exploring the relationship between two quantitative variables, the time to complete 20 shuttle runs during training (in seconds) and the time to complete the obstacle course during competition (in seconds).

Correct. The coach wants to know if there is an association between two quantitative variables, the time to complete 20 shuttle runs during training (in seconds) and the time to complete the obstacle course during competition (in seconds).
